name: Db

unions.name: Db
unions.comment: Short for "Database", it stores data by unique identifiers

values.name: fromList
values.comment: Initialize a `Db` from a list of id-value pairs

values.name: get
values.comment: Get the item under the provided `Id`

values.name: getMany
values.comment: Get many items from a `Db` from a list of `Ids`. Elements not in the `Db` simply wont appear in the return result.
values.type: Db.Db item -> List.List Id.Id -> List.List item

values.name: getManyWithId
values.comment: Get many items from a `Db`, but dont filter out missing results, and pair results with their `Id`
values.type: Db.Db item -> List.List Id.Id -> List.List ( Id.Id, Maybe.Maybe item )

values.name: getWithId
values.comment: Just like `get`, except it comes with the `Id`, for those cases where you dont want the item separated from its `Id`
values.type: Db.Db item -> Id.Id -> ( Id.Id, Maybe.Maybe item )

values.name: insert
values.comment: Insert an item into the `Db` under the given `Id`
values.type: Id.Id -> item -> Db.Db item -> Db.Db item

values.name: insertMany
values.comment: Insert many items into the `Db` under their given `Id`s
values.type: List.List ( Id.Id, item ) -> Db.Db item -> Db.Db item

values.name: map
values.comment: Map a `Db` to a different data type.

values.name: mapItem
values.comment: Apply a change to just one item in the `Db`, assuming the item is in the `Db` in the first place. This function is just like `update` except deleting the item is not possible.
values.type: Id.Id -> (item -> item) -> Db.Db item -> Db.Db item

values.name: remove
values.comment: Remove the item at the given `Id`, if it exists

values.name: update
values.comment: Update an item in a `Db`, using an update function. If the item doesnt exist in the `Db`, it comes into the update as `Nothing`. If a `Nothing` comes out of the update function, the value under that id will be removed.
values.type: Id.Id -> (Maybe.Maybe item -> Maybe.Maybe item) -> Db.Db item -> Db.Db item

name: Id

values.name: decoder
values.comment:
Decode an `Id`

    Decode.decodeString (Decode.field "id" Id.decoder) "{\"id\":\"19\"}"
    -- Ok (Id "19") : Result String Id

values.name: encode
values.comment:
Encode an `Id`

    Encode.encode 0 (Id.encode id)
    -- ""hDFL0Cs2EqWJ4jc3kMtOrKdEUTWh"" : String

    [ ("id", Id.encode id) ]
        |> Encode.object
        |> Encode.encode 0

    -- {\"id\":\"hDFL0Cs2EqWJ4jc3kMtOrKdEUTWh\"} : String

values.name: fromString
values.comment:
Make an id from a string

    Id.fromString "vq93rUv0A4"

values.name: generator
toString
values.comment: Extract the string from an id.
